meanings.definition: Ready to conform to the authority or will of others.
meanings.sent1: The dog was submissive to its owner's commands.
meanings.sent2: She always appeared submissive in front of her strict teacher.
meanings.sent3: The robot's submissive behavior towards humans was both impressive and amusing.
meanings.sent4: The submissive waves obediently followed the moon's pull.
meanings.sent5: The submissive kitten melted into a puddle of compliance.

meanings.definition: Inclined or willing to submit to orders or wishes of others.
meanings.sent1: He had a submissive attitude towards his boss.
meanings.sent2: The soldier's submissive nature made him a valuable team player.
meanings.sent3: The submissive alarm clock decided to wake up early for a change.
meanings.sent4: The submissive river flowed gently in the direction of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: Her submissive acceptance of criticism helped her improve her work.

meanings.definition: Showing a willingness to be controlled by others.
meanings.sent1: The submissive student always followed the teacher's instructions.
meanings.sent2: The cat's submissive behavior towards its owner was endearing.
meanings.sent3: The submissive traffic light decided to turn red just for fun.
meanings.sent4: The submissive wind carried the scent of flowers across the field.
meanings.sent5: His submissive demeanor made him an easy target for manipulation.
